Package org.jtrim.event

Contains classes and interfaces for dispatching and handling event notifications.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    EventCauses
    Defines the chain of events leading to a specific part of a code in the execution.
    EventDispatcher<EventListenerType,ArgType>
    Defines an interface to invoke specific kinds of event handlers.
    EventTracker
    Defines an interface for tracking the causality between events.
    ListenerManager<ListenerType>
    Defines a ListenerRegistry which allows events to be dispatched to registered listeners directly.
    ListenerRef
    Defines a reference of an event handler which has been registered to be notified of a certain event.
    ListenerRegistry<ListenerType>
    Defines a collection of event listeners which can be notified of events in an implementation dependent way.
    SimpleListenerRegistry<ListenerType>
    Defines the interface to register event listeners to be notified later in an implementation dependent way.
    TrackedEventListener<ArgType>
    Defines an event listener for TrackedListenerManager instances of an EventTracker.
    TrackedListenerManager<ArgType>
    Defines a ListenerRegistry which allows events to be dispatched to registered listeners directly and the TrackedListenerManager will supply the causes of the events for the listener.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractEventCauses
    A convenient base class for EventCauses implementations.
    CopyOnTriggerListenerManager<ListenerType>
    An ListenerManager implementation which creates a copy of the currently registered listeners when dispatching events.
    EventListeners
    Contains static utility methods for listener dispatching.
    InitLaterListenerRef
    Defines a ListenerRef forwarding its calls to another ListenerRef which is specified after construction time.
    LinkedEventTracker
    An EventTracker implementations which stores the causes in a singly linked list.
    ListenerRegistries
    Defines static utility methods for listener registries.
    LocalEventTracker
    An EventTracker implementation allowing to remove all the registered event handlers in a single method call.
    OneShotListenerManager<ListenerType,ArgType>
    A ListenerRegistry implementation which will automatically unregister listeners once they have been notified by an onEvent call.
    ProxyListenerRegistry<ListenerType>
    Defines a SimpleListenerRegistry which is backed by another SimpleListenerRegistry.
    TrackedEvent<ArgType>
    Defines an event and its causing events.
    TriggeredEvent<ArgType>
    Defines an event which has occurred or yet to be occur.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    UnregisteredListenerRef
    A ListenerRef which defines a listener which is already unregistered and will not be notified of events.

Package org.jtrim.event Description

Contains classes and interfaces for dispatching and handling event notifications.

Listener Managers

Listener managers are designed to store listeners which are to be notified later when the actual event occurs. This container considerably eases the developer's work when event dispatching is required.

Note that removing an added listener is different than removing a listener using the usual idiom in Swing (i.e.: invoking a removeXXX method with the same listener). ListenerManager implementations return a reference to the added listener, which can be used to remove the listener. This is more flexible way to remove listeners and allows for better implementations.

Event trackers

Event trackers help keep tracking of what event was cause by what event. This enables to detect recursive invocation of events and makes it possible to avoid infinite loops.
See Also:
EventTracker, EventListeners, ListenerManager
